author: sstreet
title: Barnet’s Ruben Bover played alongside Thierry Henry, Raul, Marcos Senna, Tim Cahill and Juninho Pernambucano in New York – here is his story
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments RUBEN BOVER might have said a Thierry farewell to New York – but is relishing his fresh start at Barnet. 
The Spanish midfielder spent four years in The Big Apple, where he played alongside superstars Thierry Henry , Raul and Marcos Senna. News Group Newspapers Ltd 6 Ruben Bover played alongside some of football’s greats 
His time amid the glitz and glamour of The City That Never Sleeps came after he started his career in non-league at Kidderminster Harriers. 
He went on to play in front of 20,000 fans in the MLS with former Everton star Tim Cahill, free-kick maestro Juninho Pernambucano and Arsenal legend Henry at New York Red Bulls. 
Bover says: “Thierry is the best I’ve ever played with – he is top level, a different class. All he has done is because he worked hard for it. 
“Playing next to him, I learned something every day. It’s a thing I can take into my game now and move forward. He is one of the best strikers in the history of this game. New York Red Bulls and New York City fans clash before the Major 
“I learnt from him that if you want something you have to work hard, improve every day and do extra work in training - and then maybe one day you will achieve all that he has.” 
And the former France striker, famous for his va-va-voom, taught Bover that passion and enjoyment were just as important as hard work and talent on the road to greatness. 
Bover, 24, says: “He showed you have to have love and passion for the game. He was a great character in the dressing room, too. Thierry is serious sometimes because he has to be, but he’s also really funny. Getty Images Bover calls Henry 'the best I ever played with' Corbis The Barnet midfielder shared a room with Marcos Senna (right) at New York Cosmos Reuters 6 He says that, as a Spaniard, it was incredible to play with Raul (above) 
“Most of the guys in New York, him, Juninho, Tim Cahill, all these superstar players, they would mess around with you but also work as hard as anyone there.” 
Bover has joined the Bees after leaving his last club New York Cosmos at the beginning of December when the North American Soccer League outfit released a raft of players amid reports the owners of the second tier side were looking to sell. 
The franchise made famous by Pele fell into financial difficulty despite securing back-to-back titles in November. 
Mallorca-born Bover played with Spain legends Raul and Marcos Senna at the Cosmos and credits his compatriots as much as Henry with shaping him as a footballer. 
He says: “I had the luck to play with top players, people who I wanted to be like one day. Raul is another legend – especially for me as a Spanish guy watching him play for the national team. Being able to play next to him every day was amazing. 
“I also shared a room with Marcos Senna, another Spanish legend who won the Euros. He had the biggest impact on my game as a midfielder. Last season I played every game because I learned so much from him. News Group Newspapers Ltd Senna and Raul celebrate winning the NASL Getty Images 6 'Superstar player' Tim Cahill was also a teammate at New York Red Bulls 
“All those players did, you can see why they did it. Their personality says everything about them. You see them as superstars but they are normal people. Winning the league with them was amazing.” 
Despite his triumphs in America, Bover found himself without a club in early December and had an extended holiday back home in Mallorca before Barnet came knocking at the end of January. 
He is the latest of seven new faces at the recently refurbished Hive and says his new club matches his ambitions – despite perhaps lacking some of the New York glamour. Bover says: “When you have players like Thierry, Juninho, Raul and Senna, they bring so many fans with them. People from all over the world would come and you played in some great atmospheres. It was a very good feeling. 
“For me New York is the best city in the world. You can do anything you want – you can do something different every day. But I wanted to improve as a player and grow and the best leagues are in England – that’s why I came here and I’m very excited to be with Barnet. 
“I was back home in Mallorca for a month and a half. It’s a long time for holidays, but this opportunity came and I didn’t think twice about it. I trained with them and liked it and they liked me so I’m moving forward. 
“In training you can see already people settling in. I am the latest one but you can see everyone is gelling. It’s an amazing atmosphere down here and that’s going to help the team achieve our goal to go up to League One. This club deserve to be higher.”
